'Sodium laureth sulfate', or 'sodium lauryl ether sulfate' ('SLES'), is an
anionic detergent and surfactant found in many personal care products (soaps,
shampoos, toothpaste etc.). SLES is an inexpensive and very effective foaming
agent. Kurt Kosswig,"Surfactants" in Ullmann's Encyclopedia of
Industrial Chemistry, Wiley-VCH, 2005, Weinheim.  SLES, SLS, ALS and
sodium pareth sulfate are surfactants that are used in many cosmetic products
for their cleansing and emulsifying properties. They behave similarly to soap.
